會員委 設建 庫 水 門 石
SHIHMEN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
SDC - 5098
May 9, 1962
Mr. K. T. Li, Secretary-General Council for United States Aid 118 Hwaining Street Taipei, Taiwan
Subject:
GSA Surplus Equipment
Dear Mr. Li:
Please refer to the attached copy of Mr. G. C. Johnson's letter MK-1487 dated May 8, 1962, subject as above.
It is recommended by MKA that the equipment as shown in Mr. Johnson's letter are required by the Shihmen Project for meeting the pre- sent work. We, therefore request your immediate arrangement with AID/M to allocate these compressors to Shihmen Project.
140.112.213.82
Your action on this matter will be highly appreciated.
Very truly yours, SHIHMEN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
のと
W.1.1. 1h W. K. Ku Chief Engineer

lines.content: 會員委 設建 庫 水 門 石
Please refer to the attached copy of Mr. G. C. Johnson's letter
MK-1487 dated May 8, 1962, subject as above.
It is recommended by MKA that the equipment as shown in Mr.
Johnson's letter are required by the Shihmen Project for meeting the pre-
sent work. We, therefore request your immediate arrangement with AID/M
to allocate these compressors to Shihmen Project.
Your action on this matter will be highly appreciated.

paragraphs.content: 會員委 設建 庫 水 門 石
Mr. K. T. Li, Secretary-General Council for United States Aid 118 Hwaining Street Taipei, Taiwan
Please refer to the attached copy of Mr. G. C. Johnson's letter MK-1487 dated May 8, 1962, subject as above.

It is recommended by MKA that the equipment as shown in Mr. Johnson's letter are required by the Shihmen Project for meeting the pre- sent work. We, therefore request your immediate arrangement with AID/M to allocate these compressors to Shihmen Project.
Your action on this matter will be highly appreciated.
Very truly yours, SHIHMEN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
W.1.1. 1h W. K. Ku Chief Engineer
cc : Mr. J. B. Carter, AID/M Mr. G. C. Johnson, MKA
